answers.answer: I'd be ready.  If you know the conception date then I mean,  seriously your doctor's should trust you!

I too am struggling with both. I know the day I conceived as well and due date was set for 12/29 after ultrasound now its 1/4/15. And my baby is still measuring at original due date. So I too am prepared to deliver at original due date

I'm 33weeks and my baby is measuring over a lb heavier then my due date. I too knew to the day of conception I kept an app of all things to keep track. But anyway even being large no diabetes or blood pressure problem they are keeping me at my original due date. Said no delivery before 39 weeks... Ahhh already measures 5 lbs come on lol... But I want healthy n able to go home so.

I'd be prepared for your original date as you said u know when u conceived but also baby's don't always decide to come on time lol some early some late so I'd probably just make sure u have a hospital bag ready 2 weeks before your original due date and just go from there :)

question: Before I ever took an ultrasound, calculations for my due date were based off of a known conception date and known last menstrual date which put my original guessed due date at December 27/28, 2014. I know it's rare to know conception date but I do exactly. However, AFTER my first 12 week ultrasound they moved my due date back to January 10, 2015. Around 25 weeks, they moved my due date up a day to January 9, 2015. Well today at my 34 week scan, I noticed the gestational age for my baby was dated 36 weeks and she weighs in the top 10% at 5 lbs 9 ounces for a 34 week baby. The average baby at 34 weeks is between 4-5. They did not mention changing my due date though. It just seems bizarre that she is actually measuring to what my original due date was (2 weeks prior) and it hasn't been changed. Has anyone dealt with this? Or do you think I will go into labor early?
title: my set due date vs ultrasound gestational age?
